isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - INSTRUMENTS (New Data Link Driven Instrument Cluster) - CLUSTER FAILURE DIAGNOSIS - VOLTMETER DISPLAY FAILURE

svcproc.title: VOLTMETER DISPLAY FAILURE
svcproc.para: If the voltmeter display is indicating a problem, the circuits that serve it must be checked for clean, tight, unbroken and non-shorted connections. If the circuits check OK, measure the appropriate voltage at the appropriate cluster harness connector (refer to CLUSTER HARNESS CONNECTORS and GROUP 08 - ELECTRICAL, Circuit Diagrams). Turn the key switch to ACC and read across the accessory voltage and ground with a good test voltmeter. Replace the voltmeter display gauge if it does not read near the test accessory voltage.
